sections.title: Welcome to FRC Programming
sections.content: FIRST Robotics Competition (FRC) is the highest level of FIRST robotics, featuring large robots that compete in complex game scenarios. This course will teach you how to program these robots using Java and the WPILib framework.

sections.title: What is FRC?
sections.content:
• Large Scale: Robots are 120+ pounds and compete on a 27' x 54' field
  • Complex Gameplay: Each season features a new game with multiple objectives
  • Professional Tools: Uses industrial-grade components and software
  • Team Competition: 3v3 alliance format with strategic gameplay
  • Career Preparation: Skills directly transfer to engineering careers

sections.title: Programming in FRC
sections.content:
FRC robots are programmed using:

Java: Primary programming language
WPILib: FIRST's robotics library for Java
Command-Based Programming: Advanced software architecture
PID Control: Precise motion and positioning
Vision Processing: Camera-based autonomous navigation

sections.title: Course Structure
sections.content:
This course covers:

WPILib Introduction: Understanding the framework
Motor Control: Driving and mechanism control
Commands & Subsystems: Command-based architecture
PID Control: Precise positioning and motion
Advanced Features: Vision, autonomous, and optimization
